content: the story i wanted to make a bandana and i thought this would be a cute little thing to whip up for spring and summer markets while the stitches are a bit more advanced they re easy to do once you get into the swing of things i hope you enjoy it 1 things you ll need ● 150 yards of worsted weight yarn ● 5mm/h crochet hook ● yarn needle ● scissors ● stitch markers stitches and techniques to know ● chain - chain ● double_crochet - double_crochet ● single_crochet - single_crochet ● skip st - skip stitch ● half_double_crochet - half_double_crochet ● in the third loop - work into the back third loop of a half_double_crochet ● in the front loop flo - work into the front loop of a half_double_crochet from the row before ● fpdc - front post double_crochet ● bpdc - back post double_crochet ● ex-puff - extended puff yarn over pull up a loop yarn over pull up a loop yarn over pull up a loop pull through all but the last two loops on your hook yarn over and pull through the two loops see tips and tricks section for a video ● chainless double_crochet - see tips and tricks section for a video tips and tricks ● you will always turn at the start of each row ● stitch markers will help if they are placed in your peak the chain 2 space in the middle of each row and at the end of the row to help you find your last stitch ● gauge does not matter in this pattern i have had success doing this in a slightly thick dk-weight yarn with similar results 2 ● you don t have to use the chainless double_crochet to start your row but it will make a nicer-looking edge ● extended puff video ● chainless double_crochet video start with magic_ring you will be working in row so there is no need to join with a sl st to the first stitch row 1 chain 2 or chainless double_crochet double_crochet 7x into circle 8dc row 2 chain 2 or chainless double_crochet double_crochet into first stitch double_crochet 1x in the next 3 stitches chain 2 double_crochet 1x in the next 3 stitches double_crochet 2x in last st 3 row 3 chain 1 does not count as a stitch half_double_crochet 2x into first stitch half_double_crochet 1x in each stitch until you get to the chain 2 space half_double_crochet 2x into chain space chain 2 half_double_crochet 2x into chain space half_double_crochet 1x in each stitch until the last stitch remains half_double_crochet 2x in last stitch row 4 chain 1 does not count as a stitch single_crochet 2x into first stitch single_crochet flo 1x into each stitch until you reach the chain 2 space single_crochet 2x into chain space chain 2 single_crochet 2x into chain space single_crochet flo 1x in each stitch until you reach the last stitch single_crochet 2x into last stitch row 5 chain 2 or
